moves.1. e4: This is a return game against heart-bleeads, I lost the first game, now with white. I have to admit there is no opening I know better than the absolute standard one, so here it goes.
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 Bc5 3. Bc4 d6 4. h3: I didn't even want him to think about going to g4 with his bishop, so I stopped him preemptively.
moves.4... h6 5. Nc3 a6: he obviously doesn't like my light figures to snoop around in his area.
moves.6. d4: Let's clear some space in the center, it's getting too crowded.
moves.6... exd4 7. Nxd4 Bxd4 8. Qxd4: Bam Boom Bam and out is the queen and it even threatens the pawn on g7. Coincidence? Who knows. ;)
moves.8... Qf6: He saw it coming, and he took out the big ones. Should I, or shouldn't I exchange?
moves.9... Nxf6 10. O-O: Let's give ourselves a little more safety.
moves.10... Be6: What? He wants to exchange more? But we just...? Hmmm...
moves.11. Bd5: If you want to exchange, do it as I want, with my white pawn out of the way on the e line
moves.11... Bxd5 12. exd5: Well, that worked, the line is free, let's nag him a little with the rook.
moves.12... Nbd7 13. Re1+ Kd8: So much for your rochade - that THAT. But what now, there's so much space...
moves.14... Re8: Oh nooo, more exchanges? He knows about my poor end game, doesn't he?
moves.15. Bf4: I say no and take out my 2nd bishop instead.
moves.15... Nb6: Now he's getting aggressive. My poor pawn on d5.
moves.16. Rxe8+: So I distract him first with the rook exchange.
moves.16... Kxe8 17. Rd1: And the other goes to save the pawn.
moves.17... Kd7: He makes way for his rook.
moves.18... Nc4: So he goes after my backup troops
moves.20... Ne4: Uh oh, the air is getting thin, I have this feeling.
moves.21. Rd4: You cannot defend two knights with one move, right?
moves.22... Nxd5: Ok, for now everything is in balance. I'm one pawn short, no big deal. But what to do now?
moves.23. Bg3: I can't let my rook defend so many figures, so I take a little weight off.
moves.24... Nd5: Didn't you just come from here?
moves.25. Rd4: Let's keep that knight on the move.
moves.25... Nc3 26. Kf2: Again, I had this feeling, so I went up with the king to be able to assist the pawns.
moves.26... Re2+: Should have seen that, but no one is hurt, right?
moves.28. Rc4: Hahaaa, one of you has to go - you pick.
moves.29. Be1 Na2: Or so I thought. Went from a threat to a nice clean exchange. Well, what could I do?
moves.30. Rxc1 Nxc1: Ok, I can definitely see an end game here, so I have to look at the pawns again, especially since I'm two short. But mine are already half way, so maybe it'll all work out.
moves.31... g6: Who would have though. But I see a nice place up there.
moves.32. Bg7: That's a good spot for a swift bishop.
moves.33. gxh5: Let's fight. There can be only one. And I have the church with me, in form of a bishop.
moves.33... gxh5 34. Kg2: I'll just go and pick up those two black pawnies.
moves.34... Nd3: Yeah, he's gonna get one of them.
moves.38... c5: This could be a close race.
moves.39... Nc4: This was the big mistake. Why he opened the diagonal up for my bishop while at the same time blocking his pawn, I'll never know. But thanks.
moves.40. Kg5: Let's make way and go for that 2nd black pawn.
moves.40... Ne5: You like jumping back and forth, don't you? But you gave me a head start now, so let's go.
moves.41. h5 Ke8: Yeah, he has to try to stop me now.
moves.42. h6: But he can't with that bishop in the way.
moves.42... f6+: So he opens the way and checks me.
moves.43. Kxf6: I don't think that was worth it, since he still can't go for my bishop.
moves.44. h7: Ok, I'll just move away from that knight, ok? I already can see now, that I'll switch my pawn with the knight, which is a sweet deal, considering it's his last figure.
moves.44... c4: No worries, the bishop will save me. Let's get active.
moves.47. Ke6 c2 48. Bb2: Just in time. Now it's easy.
moves.49... Ke7 50. Ke5: You want that pawn? Not yet.
moves.50... Kf7 51. f6: I'll just move it into the safe zone.
moves.52... Kf7 53. Kc7: I'll just grab these two, ok?
moves.54. Bxc1 Kxf6: Of course, but I still got one in the oven, and you can't get that.
moves.55. Kxb7 Ke7 56. Kxa6 Kd7 57. Kb6 Kc8 58: Now the path is clear and it's just a matter of time.
moves.62. Qe4+: Which corner will it be, black king? left or right?
moves.68... Kh8 69. Qh6#: That's it. Why didn't that work in the first game?
